text: Holmium(III) fluoride is an inorganic compound with a chemical formula of HoF3. It can be produced by reacting holmium oxide and ammonium fluoride, then crystallising it from the ammonium salt formed in solution.Christoph Janiak, Hans-Jürgen Meyer, Dietrich Gudat, Ralf Alsfasser: Riedel Moderne Anorganische Chemie. Walter de Gruyter, 2012, , S. 371 (eingeschränkte Vorschau in der Google-Buchsuche). It is a yellowish powder that is hard to dissolve in water. ==References== Category:Holmium compounds Category:Fluorides
title: Holmium(III) fluoride
